revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{confix|en|xeno|phone}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|UK}} {{IPA|en|/ˈzɛn.ə.fəʊn/}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|phonetics}} A [[sound]] in speech that is not native to the language being spoken; a sound from a foreign language ===References=== The term was introduced in: [http://roberteklund.info Robert Eklund] & Anders Lindström. 1998. How To Handle “Foreign” Sounds in Swedish Text-to-Speech Conversion: Approaching the ‘Xenophone’ Problem. ''Proceedings of The International Conference on Spoken Language Processing'', 30 November–5 December 1998, Sydney, Australia. Paper 514, vol. 7, pp. 2831–2834. [https://web.archive.org/web/20050518114442/http://www.ida.liu.se/~g-robek/icslp98xeno.pdf] Also see: [http://xenophones.info] http://xenophones.info
